A man has been jailed for eight years for the repeated sexual abuse and rape of his younger brother. Over the course of a decade John Murphy abused his brother who was aged between ten and 20 years old. The abuse took place in the family home in a town in Cork between 1988 and 1997. The Central Criminal Court heard that the victim, now aged in his 40s, wished to waive his anonymity so that his abuser could be identified

Sophia Murphy, now 33, waived her anonymity after father John was jailed for 18 years for the ‘horrendous’ sexual abuse of his daughter from the age of three to 15. Her father, 61, pleaded guilty to raping, indecent assault and sexual assault. Ms Murphy said that 'silence protects the abuser and imprisons the victim'
